Notes: Tranche 3A with CAPTOR-E AESA (250 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 4-6 Meteor missiles for high-volume BVR; 45 more on order (delivery 2026-2030); Ala 11/14 at Morón/Torrejón, core for NATO QRA with 140 km effective envelope via shared E-3A cueing.

Tranche 2 backbone with upgraded CAPTOR radar (200 km) and Meteor/AIM-120C-7 mixed loads; OFP-02 modernizations (2025 IOC) add AI and drone integration; sustains BVR in mixed ops with F/A-18, across 4 squadrons.

Tranche 1 with baseline CAPTOR (150 km) and Meteor upgrades; mid-life extensions to 2030 for volume filler; integrated with Ground Master 400 radars for 130 km engagements in Balearic/Mediterranean patrols.

Upgraded single-seat with AN/APG-65(V)2 radar (120 km), 6-8 AIM-120C-7 loads, and ALQ-165 EW; post-2024 crash fleet at 69; Ala 15 at Zaragoza, excels in maritime BVR with NATO datalinks for 140 km envelope.
Two-seat variant with identical AN/APG-65 radar and 4-6 AIM-120C-7 missiles for tactics and operational BVR; supports ELINT fusion and two-ship formations; bridging to Eurofighter full IOC by 2030.
Multirole with underwing pods for probe refueling, extending BVR sorties by 2+ hours; 13 more on order (delivery 2026+); GR.31 at Zaragoza, enables rapid deployment for surge ops in NATO exercises.
MRTT with boom/probe for sustained Typhoon/F-18 BVR patrols; second unit IOC Oct 2025, +1 conversion from ex-Iberia A330; enhances power projection in Indo-Pacific/Med ops via E-7 interoperability.
Dedicated EW platform with jamming pods to suppress enemy radars, enabling BVR "permission to shoot"; single unit at Torrejón, upgrades in 2025 for GPS-denied support to fighter salvos.
